intro: Coccoloba linearilanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved beautyberry, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by blue-black berries that are attractive to birds. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate partial shade.
